recipe.title: Grandma's Swedish Meatballs a lá Grandpa

ingredient.li: Some brown sauce of unknown origin

recipetext.li: Heat oven to 280°C. Line 30x20cm pan with foil; spray with cooking spray.
In large bowl, mix all ingredients. Shape mixture into 20 to 24 (eyeball sized) meatballs. Place 2 cm apart in pan.
Bake uncovered 18 to 22 minutes or until no longer pink in center.
Throw meatballs violently into the mashed potatoes
Pour copious amounts of brown sauce over your creation and think about what you've done.
In a large bowl, sift together the flour, baking powder, salt and sugar. Make a well in the center and pour in the milk, egg and melted butter; mix until smooth.
Heat a lightly oiled griddle or frying pan over medium high heat. Pour or scoop the batter onto the griddle, using approximately 1/4 cup for each pancake. Brown on both sides and serve hot.
Place the 2 sausages on top and serve.
